thine.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The Anglican version of the Lord's Prayer ends with the line: For Thine is the Kingdom, the Power and the Glory, forever and ever, Amen.
thine.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a word meaning your, used before a word beginning with a vowel or ‘h’
thine.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The title of the poem is 'Drink to me only with thine eyes'.
